faq.question: What platforms support the sd CLI tool?
faq.answer: sd works on macOS, Linux, and Windows via WSL. Install with 'brew install sd' on macOS or 'cargo install sd' cross-platform.

faq.question: How is sd different from sed?
faq.answer: sd is global by default, uses simpler syntax without delimiters, and has better regex support without escaping slashes.

faq.question: Does this skill execute commands?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides documentation and patterns. Users must have sd installed and execute commands through their terminal.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using sd?
faq.answer: Yes. sd runs locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers. Always preview changes before applying.

faq.question: Can sd damage my files?
faq.answer: Yes, improper patterns can cause data loss. Always preview with ripgrep first and use version control before bulk changes.

faq.question: What if I make a mistake?
faq.answer: Use git to revert changes: 'git checkout .' to undo all uncommitted changes, or 'git log' to find and restore specific versions.
